this_title: IMAGE MISSING or SCENES BASED ON AN UNREALIZED PLAY  BY BERTOLT BRECHT (1939)  AND LATER REIMAGINED  BY PETER WEISS (1978)   ABOUT ENGELBREKT AND  THE PEASANT UPRISING IN  SWEDEN 1434-36: SCRIPT
trans_title: 失落的影像，或基于贝托尔特·布莱希特1939年未排演的剧本以及彼得·魏斯于1978年的重新设想的，关于恩厄尔布雷克特和1434-36年瑞典农民起义的场景：剧本
introduction: https://iffr.com/en/2020/films/image-missinghttp://kkh.diva-portal.org/smash/record.jsf?pid=diva2%3A1328871&dswid=625Point of departure is an unfinished script for a never-realised play, written by Bertolt Brecht during his exile in Stockholm 1939-40. The fragments of script were later revived in 1978, when the German-Swedish author Peter Weiss constructed a fictive, albeit detailed, imaginary description that completes the play.
